models.hooks: Each hook is an open-source Claude Code hook listed in the directory. The Hook Catalog displays all hooks in a responsive card grid. Each hook has a display name, description from GitHub, star count, purpose category, lifecycle event, and a link to the source repository.
models.purposeCategories: The eight classifications of what a hook does: Safety, Automation, Notification, Formatting, Testing, Security, Logging, and Custom. Displayed as a badge on each hook card.
models.lifecycleEvents: The five points in the Claude Code execution lifecycle when a hook can fire: PreToolUse, PostToolUse, UserPromptSubmit, Notification, and Stop. Displayed as a badge on each hook card.
models.emptyState: Fallback content shown when the catalog has zero hooks (empty manifest edge case).

relationships: Each Hook has exactly one PurposeCategory (what it does)
Each Hook has exactly one LifecycleEvent (when it fires)
The Hook Catalog renders all hooks in a card grid — no pagination

emptyState.title: No hooks yet
emptyState.message: The catalog is empty. Check back soon — new hooks are added regularly.

hooks.name: safe-rm
hooks.description: Prevents accidental deletion of critical system files and project directories by intercepting rm, rmdir, and unlink commands against a configurable blocklist of protected paths.

hooks.name: auto-prettier
hooks.description: Runs Prettier on any file modified by Claude Code, ensuring consistent code formatting without manual intervention. Supports .prettierrc configuration.

hooks.name: slack-notify
hooks.description: Sends a Slack message to a configured channel when Claude Code finishes a task, including a summary of files changed and the final status.

hooks.name: test-on-save
hooks.description: Automatically runs affected test suites after file modifications using jest --findRelatedTests, catching regressions as Claude writes code.

hooks.name: secret-scanner
hooks.description: Scans file contents for hardcoded API keys, tokens, passwords, and other secrets before allowing write operations. Uses pattern matching and entropy detection.

hooks.name: git-auto-stage
hooks.description: Stages modified files in git after successful edits, keeping the working tree clean and ready for commits.

hooks.name: change-ledger
hooks.description: Maintains a structured JSON log of every file change made during a Claude Code session, including timestamps, diffs, and tool invocations.

hooks.name: prompt-guard
hooks.description: Validates user prompts against configurable rules before submission — blocks destructive commands like 'delete everything' or 'drop database' and requests confirmation for high-risk operations.

hooks.name: dep-audit
hooks.description: Runs npm audit or pnpm audit automatically after package.json changes, blocking the session if critical vulnerabilities are introduced.

hooks.name: session-recap
hooks.description: Generates a markdown summary of the entire Claude Code session on completion — files touched, tools used, decisions made — and saves it to .claude/recaps/.

hooks.name: eslint-autofix
hooks.description: Runs ESLint with --fix on modified files after Claude Code edits them. Catches style violations and auto-corrects fixable issues before they reach code review.

hooks.name: branch-guard
hooks.description: Blocks write operations when on protected branches (main, master, production). Forces Claude Code to work on feature branches only.

hooks.name: ci-trigger
hooks.description: Triggers a CI pipeline run via GitHub Actions API when Claude Code completes a session with committed changes. Includes the session summary as the workflow dispatch payload so CI logs link back to what changed and why.

hooks.name: verbose-log
hooks.description: Logs every tool invocation to a rotating file with timestamps, arguments, and caller context. Useful for debugging hook interactions and auditing Claude Code behavior in regulated environments.

hooks.name: desktop-notify
hooks.description: Shows native OS desktop notifications for Claude Code events. Configurable per event type.

hooks.name: snapshot-test-generator
hooks.description: Automatically generates or updates Jest snapshot tests for React components after Claude Code modifies JSX/TSX files. Detects component boundaries and creates __snapshots__ entries that match the updated render output, reducing manual test maintenance.

hooks.name: input-sanitizer-and-prompt-validation-middleware
hooks.description: Strips HTML, script tags, and known injection patterns from user prompts before they reach Claude Code. Applies configurable sanitization rules and logs blocked content for review.

hooks.name: custom-metrics
hooks.description: Collects session-level metrics (duration, tool calls, files modified, tokens used) and writes them to a local JSON file or sends them to a configurable webhook endpoint. Useful for teams tracking Claude Code usage patterns across projects.
